title: COP26 Perspectives: Seriti Resources CEO Mike Teke on the Future of Coal
sub_head: Mr. Teke, whose company owns coal assets in South Africa, says decarbonization shouldn’t come at the expense of development
body:
When global leaders thrash out their climate commitments in Glasgow next month, coal is likely to be in the crosshairs.
To meet their targets for reductions in greenhouse-gas emissions, “countries will need to accelerate the phaseout of coal,” the U.K. says in its list of aims for the United Nations’ COP26 conference in Scotland. Meanwhile, banks and mining companies are stepping away from coal. Lawmakers in Europe want to tighten the continent’s emissions trading mechanism to make burning the mineral prohibitively expensive. China has committed to stop building coal-fired power plants overseas.
